articles.title: Sanatorium for War Veterans Built in Rason City
articles.content:
Sanatorium for War Veterans Built in Rason City
Rason, March 5 (KCNA) -- A sanatorium for war veterans was built in Sonbong area of Rason City. It was opened with due ceremony on Sunday.
					 The two-storey house has exercise room, indoor-wading pool, recreation room, dining hall, barber's room and other service facilities.

articles.title: Full-length Novel "Morning Glow" Sees Light
articles.content:
Full-length Novel "Morning Glow" Sees Light
Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The April 15 Literary Production Centre recently produced a full-length novel "Morning Glow".
					 The novel, part of the serial "Immortal Guidance", was written by Ri Tong Gu. 
					
					 It deals with the exploits leader Kim Jong Il performed during his student days at Kim Il Sung University with the far-sighted idea to glorify Korea true to the high intention of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Traitors Should Be Removed: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Traitors Should Be Removed: Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities are getting more desperate in the moves to stifle the DPRK in collusion with the U.S. after its successful test-fire of new strategic weapon aimed to bolster up its military capability for self-defence.
					 Such scheme is the root cause of disasters as it destroys the north-south relations and peace on the Korean peninsula and increases the danger of nuclear war, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in an article, adding:
					
					 The south Korea-U.S. "alliance" is a product of collusion between the U.S. seeking to easily realize its ambition for aggression on the DPRK with the south Korean puppet forces as bullet-shield and the pro-American traitors scheming to stifle the compatriots in the north with the backing of the U.S.
					
					 The general goal of the "alliance" is to stifle the DPRK militarily, and south Korea's cooperation with the U.S. is for a war against the DPRK.
					
					 Upset by the DPRK's might and strategic position growing remarkably stronger, the south Korean puppet group of traitors is getting hell-bent on cooperation with the U.S. for invasion of the DPRK while taking issue with its step for self-defence against the hostile forces' aggression moves as "provocation".
					
					 Owing to such disgraceful action of the group, the dignity of the Korean nation is violated and peace and security of the Korean peninsula threatened and the danger of a nuclear war is extremely increasing.
					
					 The source of calamity should be rooted out and the traitors bringing tremendous disaster to the nation be removed as early as possible.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean Warmongers Stage Exercise for Searching and Destroying Strategic Facilities of DPRK
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Warmongers Stage Exercise for Searching and Destroying Strategic Facilities of DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet military warmongers staged the largest-ever joint military exercise for searching and destroying strategic facilities of the DPRK in Phochon, Kyonggi Province from Feb. 14 to 17, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 They are mulling waging again such exercise during the Foal Eagle drill with ground, naval and air forces involved.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Vow to Lead Anti-Park Struggle
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Vow to Lead Anti-Park Struggle
Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The Situation Council of University Students for Park Geun Hye's Resignation in south Korea called a press conference in Seoul on Friday to express the will to stand in the van of the struggle for Park's impeachment, according to the south Korean internet paper Jaju Sibo.
					 Speakers at the conference declared that the students' struggle would not stop, though Park Geun Hye steps down, but continue until the regime is removed.
					
					 In a declaration on the situation, the Council stressed that university students across south Korea would fight it out to impeach Park Geun Hye and remove the regime.

articles.title: Papers Ridicule S. Korean Authorities' Disgraceful Behavior
articles.content:
Papers Ridicule S. Korean Authorities' Disgraceful Behavior
Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Leading newspapers of the DPRK in commentaries Sunday condemn the south Korean puppet group of traitors for viciously pulling up the DPRK over what they called "human rights violation" at the 34th Session of the UN Human Rights Council.
					 They charge that the group, at a consultative meeting of chief delegates to the six-party talks with its American and Japanese masters in Washington, talked about "seriousness of the north's nuclear, missile and 'human rights' issues" and zealously begged for "cooperation in complete and effective implementation" of the UN "sanctions resolution".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun terms the puppet group's deed, aimed to tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK, a shameful conduct of the confrontation maniacs with inveterate antagonism towards the compatriots in the north.
					
					 As is well-known to the world, the DPRK is a paradise of happiness where all the people live in harmony, as members of one large family under the benefits of the grateful socialist system, helping and leading each other forward, the daily says, adding:
					
					 It is very miserable for the puppet group to go such reckless though it has been forsaken and cold-shouldered by the south Korean people and the international community.
					
					 Minju Joson says that the reckless remarks of the puppet group are no more than grumble of an idiot without ability to discern between paradise and hell and a last-ditch effort of those shocked by the DPRK's nuclear deterrence for self-defence.
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities have neither face nor elementary right to talk about other's "human rights performance" as they are the worst human rights abusers, it says.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Demands Stop to North-targeted Nuclear War Drill
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Demands Stop to North-targeted Nuclear War Exercises
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean online paper Minjok Ilbo on Mar. 3 carried an editorial demanding the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces halt their nuclear war exercises to invade the north.
					 The north-targeted nuclear war exercises this year are the most dangerous war saber-rattling, the editorial said.
					
					 The editorial urged the U.S. to stop the north-targeted nuclear war exercises violating the UN Charter and opt for inking a peace treaty.

articles.title: General Association of Koreans in China Praises Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
General Association of Koreans in China Praises Kim Jong Un
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China on March 1 posted on its internet homepage "Paektu-Halla" an article titled "Victory of national reunification is sure to win thanks to peerlessly brilliant commander of Mt Paektu".
					 The article said that it is five years since respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un inspected Panmunjom in the forefront.
					
					 It noted that his inspection of Panmunjom was the historical deed of the brilliant commander of Mt Paektu as it gave the entire nation rosy hope for national reunification and confidence of certain victory and dealt a heavy blow to the U.S. and group of traitors.
					
					 Before the monument to the autograph of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Un recollected the noble exploits the President performed for national reunification, and declared to force the enemies to sign a surrender document, not an armistice agreement, if they provoke us, the article pointed out.
					
					 We have nothing to be afraid of and the final victory of the cause of national reunification is sure as Marshal Kim Jong Un is leading the Korean nation, it added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced by British Organization
Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea carried leader Kim Jong Il's work "On Strengthening the People's Army and Creating a Social Climate in Which Prominence Is Given to Military Affairs" in its special bulletin "Star of Independence" on Feb. 10.
					 The work, published on Feb. 4, Juche 81 (1992), deals with the issue of holding a large-scale military parade to celebrate the 60th founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army in the presence of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks for strengthening the People's Army and creating a social climate in which priority is given to military affairs.
					
					 The bulletin carried a portrait of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kimilsungia Greenhouse in Guinea Visited by Many People
articles.content:
Kimilsungia Greenhouse in Guinea Visited by Many People
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- A visit to the Kimilsungia Greenhouse took place in Conakry from Feb. 10 to 16 under the co-sponsorship of the Guinean preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star and the Guinean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association.
					 On display at the greenhouse were photos showing the revolutionary careers and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the revolutionary activities of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 There were also works of Kim Jong Un, photos of Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia exhibitions held in various countries and regions and books and photos introducing the reality of the DPRK.
					
					 Attending the visit-opening ceremony were personages of the Presidency, the Ministry of Environment, Water and Forest, the Central Botanical Garden and other units and staff members of the DPRK Embassy in Conakry.
					
					 Visitors were briefed on the details about how Kimjongilia came into being as immortal flower and its features.

articles.title: Meetings for Solidarity with Korean People Held in Venezuela
articles.content:
Meetings for Solidarity with Korean People Held in Venezuela
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Solidarity meetings for supporting the Korean people's cause of justice were held in Venezuela on Feb. 18 and 22.
					 Attending the meetings were personages of various political parties and organizations and popular masses of Venezuela and the DPRK ambassador to this country and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 The general secretary of the Motherland Party for All said:
					
					 Comrade Kim Il Sung, eternal president of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, is the great leader and prominent head of state as he defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation, provided the Korean people with an independent and dignified life and turned the DPRK into a socialist country independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in defence.
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il defended socialism through his distinguished ideo-theoretical activities and energetic guidance, holding aloft the banner of independence and Songun and provided the nuclear deterrence for self-defence to ensure the regional peace and security.
					
					 Today Comrade Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean party, state and army, is leading the Korean people's struggle to build a socialist power by creditably carrying forward the idea and cause of the preceding leaders.
					
					 Our Party struggling for independence, peace, justice, progress and socialism will more positively conduct solidarity activities for supporting the just cause of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people.
					
					 The general secretary of the National Leadership of the Tupamaro Revolutionary Movement said:
					
					 The looks of the heroic Korean people, who bolster up the nuclear deterrent for self-defence under the tested guidance of Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un while dealing a deadly blow at the U.S. engrossed in invasion, interference and arbitrary practice, are giving strength and courage to the world progressives including the Venezuelan people.
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people will surely emerge victorious in their struggle to defend the country's sovereignty and the nation's vital rights from the U.S. moves for a new war and push ahead with the building of socialism.
